cards.flavor: “Your past sins have been purified. Your honor remains intact.”
cards.name: Absolve

rulings.text: Any abilities that work "as long as that card remains exiled", including inscribe and prophecy, stop working because the card becomes a new object even though it remains in exile.
When it becomes a new object, it gets a new timestamp.

cards.text:
Exile any number of target cards in exile. (They become new objects that have just been exiled.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Abura-no-Oni
cards.text: When Abura-no-Oni enters, target player mills two cards.

cards.flavor: The former Emperor's retreat, Anzen became a beacon of hope in an age of darkness.
cards.name: Anzen, Beyond the Sea

rulings.text: If Anzen becomes a basic land type (even Island), it will lose the ability that causes every land to be an Island and it will not apply.

cards.text: Each land is an Island in addition to its other land types.

cards.flavor: Though lacking the years of experience of her traitorous brothers and sisters in arms, her honor remains unsoiled.
cards.name: Aokara Devoted
Aokara Duelists
cards.text:

cards.name: Aokara Elite
cards.text:
Hexproof

Flash

cards.name: End of the Empire

rulings.text: End of the Empire's last ability will trigger at any point it has no fate counters on it and the ability is not already on the stack. If it is countered, it will simply trigger again.
As End of the Empire's ability resolves, you must sacrifice it if able. If you can't, for example you no longer control it as the ability resolves, the rest of the ability does nothing.

cards.text:
As End of the Empire enters, choose a creature card name.
Whenever a creature you don't control with the chosen name dies, create a 4/4 colorless Demon Spirit creature token with menace.

cards.name: General Takaki

rulings.text: If multiple replacement effects are applied to the same permanent, that permanent's controller decides the order that they apply. in particular that means you can apply General Takaki's ability before any abilities that add or double damage apply.

General Takaki's ability works unintuitively with trample. Lethal damage is determined by the amount of damage a creature assigns (usually with its power) and not the amount of damage it will deal due to replacement effects. If you attack with a 1/1 trampler it will deal 3 damage to its blocker and no damage to the defending player.

cards.text: If a source you control would deal exactly 1 damage to a permanent or player, it deals 3 damage instead.

cards.text:
Create a 2/2 colorless Spirit creature token.
